Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Sanctum \Sanc"tum\, n. [L., p. p. of sancire to consecrate.] A sacred place; hence, a place of retreat; a room reserved for personal use; as, an editor's sanctum. [1913 Webster]
{Sanctum sanctorum} [L.], the Holy of Holies; the most holy place, as in the Jewish temple. [1913 Webster]

sanctum n 1: a place of inviolable privacy; "he withdrew to his sanctum sanctorum, where the children could never go" [syn: {sanctum sanctorum}] 2: a sacred place of pilgrimage [syn: {holy place}, {holy}] [also: {sancta} (pl)]
